benchmark_details.name: GSM-P LUS (Grade School Math - Perturbed Language Understanding System)
benchmark_details.overview: GSM-P LUS is an adversarial benchmark designed to evaluate the robustness of Large Language Models (LLMs) in mathematical problem-solving by testing a wide range of question variations and perturbations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically evaluate the robustness of LLMs in solving math word problems under various perturbations.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: GSM-P LUS mainly focuses on the robustness of math reasoning at the elementary school level.

data.source: Developed from the GSM8K dataset by introducing various perturbations.
data.annotation: Human-annotated with a rigorous quality check process.

methodology.calculation: Performance metrics calculated based on model accuracy on both GSM8K and GSM-P LUS datasets.
methodology.interpretation: Comparative analysis of performance across benchmarks to assess robustness.
methodology.baseline_results: Human performance baseline established using qualified human annotators.
methodology.validation: Cross-annotated by multiple evaluators to ensure data quality.
